fields.name: canLoseFocus
javadoc: if true the textbox can lose focus by clicking elsewhere on the screen

fields.name: displayPos
javadoc: The current character index that should be used as start of the rendered text.

fields.name: filter
javadoc: Called to check if the text is valid

fields.name: highlightPos
javadoc: other selection position, maybe the same as the cursor

fields.name: isEditable
javadoc: If this value is true along with isFocused, keyTyped will process the keys.

fields.name: value
javadoc: Has the current text being edited on the textbox.

methods.name: deleteChars
javadoc: Deletes the given number of characters from the current cursor's position, unless there is currently a selection, in which case the selection is deleted instead.

methods.name: deleteWords
javadoc: Deletes the given number of words from the current cursor's position, unless there is currently a selection, in which case the selection is deleted instead.

methods.name: getCursorPosition
javadoc: returns the current position of the cursor

methods.name: getHighlighted
javadoc: returns the text between the cursor and selectionEnd

methods.name: getInnerWidth
javadoc: returns the width of the textbox depending on if background drawing is enabled

methods.name: getMaxLength
javadoc: returns the maximum number of character that can be contained in this textbox

methods.name: getValue
javadoc: Returns the contents of the textbox

methods.name: getWordPosition
javadoc: Gets the starting index of the word at the specified number of words away from the cursor position.

methods.name: getWordPosition
javadoc: Gets the starting index of the word at a distance of the specified number of words away from the given position.

methods.name: getWordPosition
javadoc: Like getNthWordFromPos (which wraps this), but adds option for skipping consecutive spaces

methods.name: insertText
javadoc: Adds the given text after the cursor, or replaces the currently selected text if there is a selection.

methods.name: isBordered
javadoc: Gets whether the background and outline of this text box should be drawn (true if so).

methods.name: isVisible
javadoc: returns true if this textbox is visible

methods.name: moveCursor
javadoc: Moves the text cursor by a specified number of characters and clears the selection

methods.name: moveCursorTo
javadoc: Sets the current position of the cursor.

methods.name: moveCursorToEnd
javadoc: Moves the cursor to the very end of this text box.

methods.name: moveCursorToStart
javadoc: Moves the cursor to the very start of this text box.

methods.name: renderHighlight
javadoc: Draws the blue selection box.

methods.name: setBordered
javadoc: Sets whether or not the background and outline of this text box should be drawn.

methods.name: setCanLoseFocus
javadoc: Sets whether this text box loses focus when something other than it is clicked.

methods.name: setEditable
javadoc: Sets whether this text box is enabled. Disabled text boxes cannot be typed in.

methods.name: setFocus
javadoc: Sets focus to this gui element

methods.name: setHighlightPos
javadoc: Sets the position of the selection anchor (the selection anchor and the cursor position mark the edges of the selection). If the anchor is set beyond the bounds of the current text, it will be put back inside.

methods.name: setMaxLength
javadoc: Sets the maximum length for the text in this text box. If the current text is longer than this length, the current text will be trimmed.

methods.name: setTextColor
javadoc: Sets the color to use when drawing this text box's text. A different color is used if this text box is disabled.

methods.name: setTextColorUneditable
javadoc: Sets the color to use for text in this text box when this text box is disabled.

methods.name: setValue
javadoc: Sets the text of the textbox, and moves the cursor to the end.

methods.name: setVisible
javadoc: Sets whether or not this textbox is visible

methods.name: tick
javadoc: Increments the cursor counter
